9402H0105-d-02-27-94-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 580-24 WAS EASTBOUND AT BURLINGTON, ND WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. WHEN THE TRAIN CAMETO A STOP THE HEAD MAN STARTED TO WALK AND WITNESSED A FIRE AND EXPLOSION FROM THE DERAILMENT OF THE 9TH THROUGTH 33RD HEAD CARS. THE 19TH HEAD CAR, CAUGHT FIRE AND EXPLODED. A FATHER AND SON LIVINGIN A MOBILE HOME IN THE VICINITY WERE INJURED IN THE AFTERMATH. CREW MEMBERS WERE TESTED PER FRA POST ACCIDENT POLICY AND ALL TESTS WERE NEGATIVE. UNABLE TO DETERMINE EXACT CAUSE OF DERAILMENT. IN OUROPINION APPEARS TO BE A SUDDEN RUPTURE OF SOUTHERLY RAIL, WHICH WAS FELT BY HEAD-END CREW OF EASTBOUND DERAILED TRAIN. WESTBOUND TRAIN OVER AREA ONE HALF HOUR PRIOR TO DERAILMENT REPORTED NO EXCEPTIONS TO TRACK. EXTENSIVE SEARCH OF AREA WAS MADE, BUT UNABLE TO FIND EVIDENCE OF BATTERED RAIL, HOWEVER, 18 INCHES OF NORTH RAIL AND 30 INCHES OF SOUTH RAIL COULD NOT BE FOUND. PORTION OF CRACKED JOINTBARS THAT HAD BROKEN WERE FOUND AT DERAILMENT SITE, BUT APPEARS TO BE EFFECT OF DERAILMENT AND NOT CAUSE.NoneNoneNoneNone

194-d-02-11-94-PATH.Accident Cause: Snow, ice, mud, gravel, coal, sand, etc. on track
194-d-02-11-94-PATH.Narrative: THE ETHYLENE GLYCOL TRAIN WAS ON 'E' TRACK IN SOUTH STREET YARD. THE ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR REPEATEDLY TRIED TO MOVE THE TRAIN UP A GRADE OF 3.5% BUT WAS UNSUCCESSFUL DUE TO HEAVY ACCUMULATION OF SNOWAND ICE. IT WAS DECIDED BY OPERATIONS TO ADD ANOTHER TRAIN TO THE FRONT OF THE CONSIST IN ORDER TOPULL THE CARS UP THE HILL. AS SOON AS THE TRAIN STARTED TO MOVE DOWN THE GRADE, IT STARTED TO SLIDEDUE TO ICE BUILD-UP ON THE RAILS. THE CONDUCTOR APPLIED HAND BRAKES TO TRY AND STOP THE TRAIN, HOWEVER, IT CONTINUED TO SLIDE AND MADE A VERY HARD ADD INTO THE ETHYLENE GLYCOL TRAIN. FIFTEEN OF THE TWENTY-THREE CARS INVOLVED WERE DAMAGED. TOTAL COST WAS $18,045.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

022394-d-02-23-94-DLWR.Narrative: DLWR TRAIN WAS IN THE PROCESS OF CLASSIFYING INBOUND CARS FROM THE FIELD TRACKS AT BURROWS LOT YARDIN BUFFALO, NY. YADL1 HAD A CUT OF 13 LOADED GRAIN CARS AND HAD PULLED UP THE ADVANCED METALS RECYCLING LEAD TO CLEAR THE GRADE CROSSING INTO THAT INDUSTRY. AS THE TRAIN WAS STANDING THE ENGINEER STEPPED OVER TO THE FIREMAN'S SIDE TO OBSERVE HIS TRAIN, HE LOOKED AHEAD OF HIM AND SAW 3 CARS ROLLING DOWN THE TRACKS AT THE TRAIN FROM THE JUNKYARD, WITH 3 GUYS CHASING THEM. THE ENGINEER HAD NO TIME TOGET OUT OF THE WAY. THE ENGINE WAS STRUCK AND THE ENGINEER WAS KNOCKED AGAINST THE WALL; THE ENGINEAND THE FIRST CAR WERE KNOCKED OFF TRACK. ONE OF THE EMPLOYEES TRIED TO STOP THE CAR WITH A HAND BRAKE BUT REALIZED HE COULD NOT STOP THE CAR IN TIME AND JUMPED OFF THE CAR. AFTER THE ACCIDENT, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE NO HAND BRAKES APPLIED TO ANY OF THE THREE RUNAWAY CARS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

THE MAIN TRACK AUTHORITY EXTENDED BETWEENMISSISSIPPI STREET TO UNIVERSITY AVENUE ON THE WESTWARD TRACK. BN SUPERINTENDENT OF DISPATCHING ANDBN WEST HUMP TRICK DISPATCHER ADMITTED UNDER DIRECT EXAMINATION THAT WEST HUMP DISPATCHER HAD MADE AMISTAKE BY ALLOWING BOTH TRAINS TO OCCUPY THE LIMITS AT THE SAME TIME AND THAT BOTH SOO TRAIN CREWSHAD COMPILED WITH ALL THE RULES GOVERNING OCS MAIN TRACK PERMISSION. BOTH SOO CREWS OPERATED ACCORDING TO THE RULES WHICH WAS MADE CLEAR THROUGH THE COURSE OF THE INVESTIGATION. CREW MEMBERS OF BOTHSOO TRAINS WERE TESTED UNDER FRA AUTHORITY WITH ALL TEST RESULTS BEING NEGATIVE. ALL CREW MEMBERS OFBOTH SOO TRAINS SUSTAINED INJURIES.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

9402G0106-d-02-27-94-SOO.Narrative: YARD ASSIGNMENT 1394, WHILE TRAVELING SOUTHWARD AT 10MPH ON THE BRC NORTHBOUND MAIN TRACK AT CLEARING YARD, DERAILED TEN CARS. THE 20TH THROUGH 29TH CARS DERAILED, ALL UPRIGHT AND NO DAMAGE TO LADING.AFTER AN INSPECTION OF THE TRAIN, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT CPLX 302254 WAS THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT. THE BRAKE RIGGING ON THE CAR WAS HANGING AND STRUCK THE FROG AT ARCHER AVENUE. THE BRAKE RIGGINGTHEN BECAME DISLODGED UNDER THE TRUCKS OF THE CAR, CAUSING THE RAIL TO TURN AS THE TRAIN WENT INTO THE CURVE, PULLING THE TRUCKS INSIDE OF THE RAIL ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE CURVE. THE TRUCKS RODE ON THE INSIDE OF THE TURNED RAIL, CAUSING THE RAIL TO BREAK AT THE CURVE BEFORE GOING THROUGH NO. 19CROSSOVER TO THE SOUTHBOUND MAIN. JUST BEFORE NO. 19 CROSSOVER, THE TRAIN STARTED TO PULL HARD BECAUSE OF THE DERAILED CARS. THERE WAS NOINTERRUPTION OF TRAIN LINE AIR. WHEN THE ENGINEER SLOWED FOR THE CROSSOVER MOVEMENT, THE TRAIN STOPPED. THE CREW LOOKED BACK AND NOTICED THE DERAILED PORTION OF THE TRAIN. NO DISCIPLINE ACTION WAS TAKEN.NoneNoneNoneNone
